definition.text: England is a constituent country of the United Kingdom located in Western Europe. It was the core territorial and institutional base of the early modern English state and later the British Empire. England played a central role in the Industrial Revolution, the development of parliamentary governance, common law traditions, and the formation of modern financial and industrial capitalism.

works.title: Actor Set Evolution of England
works.description: Temporal analysis of England‚Äôs evolving actor space from medieval monarchy and landed aristocracy to industrial capitalists, financial institutions, parliamentary structures, and modern regulatory bodies.

works.title: Industrial Transformation Dynamics
works.description: Structured timeline of England‚Äôs transition from agrarian economy to industrial capitalism, including textile mechanization, coal-energy systems, rail infrastructure, and urbanization.

works.title: Financial and Commercial Network Structure
works.description: Network representation of merchant banks, trading companies, insurance markets, and global commercial linkages centered in London.
